title: Chicken Stir-Fry with Broccoli and Bell Peppers (Diabetes-Friendly, Quick)
description: A fast and flavorful stir-fry with lean chicken and plenty of non-starchy vegetables.
instructions: In a small bowl, toss chicken with cornstarch and 1 tsp soy sauce.
Heat sesame oil in a wok or large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add chicken and stir-fry until cooked through.
Add broccoli and bell peppers and stir-fry for 5-7 minutes until tender-crisp.
Stir in ginger and garlic and cook for 30 seconds until fragrant.
In a small bowl, whisk together remaining soy sauce and water. Add to the skillet and cook until sauce thickens slightly.
Serve hot.

title: Mediterranean Quinoa Salad (Diabetes-Friendly, Vegetarian)
description: A refreshing and filling salad with quinoa, vegetables, and a lemon-herb dressing.
instructions: In a large bowl, combine cooked quinoa, cucumber, cherry tomatoes, red onion, and olives.
In a small bowl, whisk together olive oil, lemon juice, oregano, salt, and pepper.
Pour dressing over the quinoa and vegetables and toss gently.
Stir in feta cheese, parsley, and mint.
Serve chilled or at room temperature.

title: Baked Cod with Lemon and Herbs (Low-Sodium, Quick)
description: A simple and flaky baked cod dish seasoned with fresh herbs and lemon.
instructions: Preheat oven to 200Â°C (400Â°F).
Place cod fillets on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
Drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle with rosemary, thyme, and pepper.
Arrange lemon slices on top of the cod.
Bake for 12-15 minutes, or until cod is cooked through and flakes easily with a fork.
Serve immediately.

title: Spinach and Ricotta Stuffed Shells (Kidney-Friendly, Vegetarian)
description: Large pasta shells filled with a creamy spinach and ricotta mixture.
ingredients: Frozen spinach (1 cup, thawed and squeezed dry)
instructions: Preheat oven to 180Â°C (350Â°F).
Cook pasta shells according to package directions until al dente.
In a bowl, combine ricotta cheese, spinach, egg, nutmeg, and parsley.
Fill each pasta shell with the ricotta mixture.
Spread a thin layer of tomato sauce in the bottom of a baking dish.
Arrange the stuffed shells in the dish.
Cover with remaining tomato sauce and sprinkle with mozzarella cheese.
Bake for 20-25 minutes, or until cheese is melted and bubbly.

title: Shrimp and Avocado Salad (General, Quick)
description: A refreshing and protein-packed salad with shrimp and creamy avocado.
instructions: In a bowl, combine cooked shrimp, avocado, cucumber, and red onion.
In a small bowl, whisk together lime juice, olive oil, cilantro, salt, and pepper.
Pour dressing over the shrimp and avocado mixture and toss gently.
Serve immediately.

title: Mushroom and Spinach Frittata (General, Vegetarian, Quick)
description: A quick and easy egg dish with savory mushrooms and spinach.
instructions: Heat olive oil in an oven-safe skillet over medium heat.
SautÃ© onion and mushrooms until softened.
Add spinach and cook until wilted.
In a bowl, whisk together eggs, milk, parmesan cheese, salt, and pepper.
Pour egg mixture over the vegetables in the skillet.
Cook on the stovetop for 5-7 minutes until the edges are set.
Transfer skillet to a preheated oven at 180Â°C (350Â°F) and bake for 10-15 minutes, or until the frittata is set in the center.
Serve warm.

title: Lemon Herb Chicken and Veggies (General, Quick)
description: A fast and flavorful one-pan meal with chicken and a medley of herbs and vegetables.
instructions: Preheat oven to 200Â°C (400Â°F).
Toss potatoes and carrots with 1 tbsp olive oil, salt, pepper, and garlic powder on a baking sheet.
Arrange chicken thighs and green beans on the same baking sheet.
Drizzle chicken and green beans with remaining olive oil and lemon juice.
Sprinkle rosemary and thyme over all.
Bake for 25-30 minutes, or until chicken is cooked through and vegetables are tender.
Serve hot.

title: Black Bean Burgers on Whole Wheat Buns (Diabetes-Friendly, Vegetarian)
description: Hearty and satisfying homemade black bean burgers served on whole wheat buns with your favorite toppings.
ingredients: Black beans (1 can, rinsed and drained)
instructions: Mash the black beans in a bowl with a fork.
Add oats, onion, bell pepper, garlic, cumin, and chili powder. Mix well.
Form the mixture into two patties.
Heat a little oil in a skillet over medium heat.
Cook patties for 4-5 minutes per side, or until heated through and slightly browned.
Serve on whole wheat buns with lettuce, tomato, onion, and optional avocado.

title: Sheet Pan Lemon Herb Salmon with Zucchini and Cherry Tomatoes (Low-Sodium, Quick)
description: A quick and easy sheet pan dinner featuring flavorful salmon and fresh vegetables.
instructions: Preheat oven to 200Â°C (400Â°F).
Place salmon fillets, zucchini, and cherry tomatoes on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
Drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle with fresh dill and pepper.
Arrange lemon slices among the vegetables and on top of the salmon.
Bake for 12-15 minutes, or until salmon is cooked through and flakes easily and vegetables are tender.
Serve immediately.

title: Creamy Tomato Soup with Whole Wheat Croutons (Kidney-Friendly, Vegetarian)
description: A comforting and creamy tomato soup served with crunchy whole wheat croutons.
ingredients: Canned crushed tomatoes (28 oz, low sodium)
instructions: Heat olive oil in a pot over medium heat.
SautÃ© onion until softened, then add garlic and cook for 1 minute.
Stir in crushed tomatoes, vegetable broth, and basil. Bring to a simmer and cook for 15 minutes.
While soup simmers, toss bread cubes with a little olive oil and dried herbs. Bake at 180Â°C (350Â°F) until crispy.
Blend the soup until smooth (optional). Stir in heavy cream.
Serve hot with whole wheat croutons.

title: Tofu Scramble with Bell Peppers and Onions (General, Vegetarian, Quick)
description: A quick and savory plant-based alternative to scrambled eggs.
instructions: Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat.
SautÃ© bell pepper and onion until softened.
Add crumbled tofu, nutritional yeast, turmeric, salt, and pepper.
Cook, stirring occasionally, for 5-7 minutes until heated through.
Serve warm.

title: Cucumber and Avocado Rolls (General, Vegetarian, Sushi-Like)
description: Refreshing and light rolls with cucumber and creamy avocado, a non-traditional sushi option.
ingredients: Soy sauce (low sodium, for serving, optional)
instructions: Lay a nori sheet on a bamboo rolling mat.
Spread a thin layer of sushi rice evenly over the nori, leaving a small border at the far edge.
Arrange strips of cucumber and avocado across the rice.
Using the mat, roll the nori tightly.
Moisten the far edge of the nori with water to seal the roll.
Slice the roll into 6-8 pieces.
Sprinkle with sesame seeds if desired. Serve with low-sodium soy sauce if liked.

title: Spicy Peanut Noodles with Stir-Fried Vegetables (General, Vegetarian, Quick)
description: A quick and flavorful noodle dish with a spicy peanut sauce and a variety of stir-fried vegetables.
instructions: Cook spaghetti according to package directions.
While pasta cooks, whisk together peanut butter, soy sauce, rice vinegar, honey, sriracha, garlic, and ginger in a small bowl.
Heat sesame oil in a wok or large skillet over medium-high heat.
Stir-fry broccoli and carrots for 3-5 minutes until slightly tender.
Add red bell pepper and stir-fry for another 2 minutes.
Add cooked spaghetti and peanut sauce to the skillet. Toss well to coat.
Garnish with chopped peanuts and serve immediately.

title: Baked Chicken Fajita Bowls (General, Quick)
description: Easy and flavorful baked chicken fajita bowls with bell peppers and onions.
instructions: Preheat oven to 200Â°C (400Â°F).
Toss chicken, bell peppers, and onion with olive oil and fajita seasoning on a baking sheet.
Spread in a single layer and bake for 15-20 minutes, or until chicken is cooked through and vegetables are tender.
Serve in bowls over shredded lettuce, topped with salsa, avocado, and a squeeze of lime.

title: Broccoli and Cheddar Soup (Kidney-Friendly, Vegetarian)
description: A comforting and creamy broccoli and cheddar soup that can be made with low-sodium ingredients.
ingredients: Cheddar cheese (1/2 cup, shredded, low sodium)
instructions: Heat olive oil in a pot over medium heat.
SautÃ© onion until softened, then add garlic and cook for 1 minute.
Add broccoli and vegetable broth. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer until broccoli is very tender (about 15 minutes).
Carefully blend the soup until smooth.
Return to the pot and stir in milk and cheddar cheese until melted and creamy.
Season with black pepper. Serve hot.

title: Tuna and White Bean Salad (Low-Sodium, Quick)
description: A simple and protein-rich salad with tuna, white beans, and fresh herbs.
ingredients: Canned tuna in water (1 can, drained, low sodium)
White beans (1/2 cup, rinsed and drained, low sodium)
instructions: In a bowl, flake the drained tuna.
Add white beans, celery, and red onion.
In a small bowl, whisk together olive oil, lemon juice, parsley, and pepper.
Pour dressing over the tuna and bean mixture and stir gently to combine.
Serve immediately on lettuce leaves or with whole-wheat crackers.

title: Avocado and Black Bean Salsa with Whole Wheat Tortilla Chips (Diabetes-Friendly, Vegetarian, Quick)
description: A quick and healthy salsa with avocado, black beans, and lime, served with whole wheat chips.
ingredients: Black beans (1/2 cup, rinsed and drained)
instructions: In a bowl, gently combine avocado, black beans, tomato, and red onion.
Stir in lime juice and cilantro.
Add jalapeÃ±o if desired for a bit of spice.
Serve immediately with a small portion of whole wheat tortilla chips.

title: Tofu and Vegetable Skewers with Peanut Sauce (General, Vegetarian)
description: Grilled or baked tofu and vegetable skewers served with a flavorful peanut sauce.
instructions: Preheat grill or oven to 180Â°C (350Â°F).
Thread tofu and vegetables onto skewers.
Whisk together peanut butter, soy sauce, rice vinegar, honey, and water to make the sauce.
Brush skewers with sesame oil.
Grill or bake for 15-20 minutes, turning occasionally, until tofu is lightly browned and vegetables are tender.
Serve skewers with peanut sauce on the side.

title: Spaghetti with Marinara and White Beans (General, Vegetarian, Quick)
description: A simple and satisfying pasta dish with a rich tomato sauce and protein-packed white beans.
ingredients: Canned crushed tomatoes (1 can, low sodium)
White beans (1/2 cup, rinsed and drained, low sodium)
instructions: Cook spaghetti according to package directions.
While pasta cooks, heat olive oil in a saucepan over medium heat.
SautÃ© garlic until fragrant.
Stir in crushed tomatoes, white beans, oregano, salt, and pepper.
Simmer for 10-15 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Drain spaghetti and add it to the sauce. Toss to coat.
Garnish with fresh basil and serve.

title: Lemon Dill Chicken Salad Lettuce Wraps (Low-Sodium, Quick)
description: A light and refreshing chicken salad with a bright lemon and dill flavor, served in lettuce wraps.
ingredients: Cooked chicken breast (150g, shredded, low sodium)
Lettuce leaves (e.g., romaine or butter lettuce)
instructions: In a bowl, combine shredded chicken, celery, and red onion.
In a separate small bowl, whisk together Greek yogurt, lemon juice, dill, and pepper.
Add the dressing to the chicken mixture and stir until well combined.
Spoon the chicken salad into lettuce leaves.
Serve immediately.

title: Sheet Pan Roasted Vegetables with Chickpeas (Diabetes-Friendly, Vegetarian, Quick)
description: A quick and easy sheet pan meal featuring a variety of roasted vegetables and chickpeas.
instructions: Preheat oven to 200Â°C (400Â°F).
Toss all vegetables and chickpeas with olive oil, cumin, coriander, turmeric, salt, and pepper on a large baking sheet.
Spread in a single layer.
Roast for 20-25 minutes, or until vegetables are tender and slightly browned.
Serve hot.

title: Baked Tofu with Sesame Ginger Glaze (General, Vegetarian)
description: Flavorful baked tofu with a sweet and savory sesame ginger glaze.
instructions: Preheat oven to 180Â°C (350Â°F).
In a bowl, whisk together soy sauce, rice vinegar, honey, sesame oil, ginger, garlic, and cornstarch.
Place tofu cubes in a baking dish and pour the glaze over them, ensuring they are well coated.
Bake for 20-25 minutes, flipping halfway through, until tofu is golden brown and the glaze has thickened.
Garnish with sesame seeds and serve hot.

title: Quick Tomato Basil White Bean Salad (Kidney-Friendly, Vegetarian, Quick)
description: A simple and refreshing salad with tomatoes, basil, and white beans.
ingredients: Canned cannellini beans (1 cup, rinsed and drained, low sodium)
instructions: In a bowl, gently combine cannellini beans, cherry tomatoes, red onion, and fresh basil.
In a small bowl, whisk together olive oil and red wine vinegar.
Pour dressing over the bean and vegetable mixture and toss gently.
Season with black pepper. Serve immediately.

title: Salmon Sushi Bowls (General)
description: Deconstructed sushi bowls with fresh salmon, avocado, and your favorite toppings.
instructions: Divide cooked sushi rice into bowls.
Top with cubed salmon, diced avocado, and sliced cucumber.
Sprinkle with shredded nori and sesame seeds.
Serve with low-sodium soy sauce and pickled ginger on the side.

title: Chicken Lettuce Wraps with Peanut Sauce (General, Quick)
description: A light and flavorful dish with seasoned ground chicken served in crisp lettuce cups with a creamy peanut sauce.
ingredients: Lettuce leaves (e.g., romaine or butter lettuce)
instructions: Heat sesame oil in a skillet over medium heat.
Add ground chicken and cook until browned.
Stir in water chestnuts and carrot and cook for 2-3 minutes.
Add soy sauce and rice vinegar and cook until liquid is absorbed.
In a small bowl, whisk together peanut butter, honey, and sriracha. Add a little water if needed to thin.
Spoon chicken mixture into lettuce leaves. Drizzle with peanut sauce and sprinkle with green onions.

title: Zucchini Noodles with Pesto and Cherry Tomatoes (Diabetes-Friendly, Vegetarian, Quick)
description: A light and refreshing low-carb pasta alternative with vibrant pesto and sweet cherry tomatoes.
instructions: Spiralize the zucchini into noodles (zoodles).
Gently toss the zucchini noodles with pesto in a bowl.
Stir in halved cherry tomatoes.
Sprinkle with toasted pine nuts and optional parmesan cheese.
Serve immediately.

title: Baked Salmon with Roasted Red Peppers and Olives (Low-Sodium)
description: Flaky baked salmon with the sweet and savory flavors of roasted red peppers and olives.
ingredients: Roasted red peppers (1 cup, sliced, low sodium)
Kalamata olives (1/4 cup, halved, low sodium)
instructions: Preheat oven to 200Â°C (400Â°F).
Place salmon fillets on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
Arrange roasted red peppers and olives around the salmon.
Drizzle everything with olive oil and sprinkle with minced garlic, oregano, and pepper.
Bake for 12-15 minutes, or until salmon is cooked through and flakes easily.
Serve with lemon wedges.

title: Creamy Mushroom Soup (Kidney-Friendly, Vegetarian)
description: A rich and comforting creamy mushroom soup, made with kidney-friendly considerations.
instructions: Heat olive oil in a pot over medium heat.
SautÃ© onion until softened, then add mushrooms and cook until browned and softened.
Stir in garlic and thyme and cook for 1 minute.
Add vegetable broth and bring to a simmer. Cook for 15 minutes.
Carefully blend the soup until smooth.
Return to the pot and stir in heavy cream and black pepper. Heat through gently.
Garnish with fresh chives before serving.

title: Spicy Tuna Rolls (General, Sushi)
description: Classic spicy tuna sushi rolls with a kick.
ingredients: Canned tuna in water (1 can, drained)
instructions: In a bowl, flake the drained tuna and mix with mayonnaise and sriracha.
Lay a nori sheet on a bamboo rolling mat.
Spread a thin layer of sushi rice evenly over the nori, leaving a small border at the far edge.
Arrange a line of spicy tuna mixture, avocado slices, and cucumber slices across the rice.
Using the mat, roll the nori tightly.
Moisten the far edge of the nori with water to seal the roll.
Slice the roll into 6-8 pieces.
Serve with low-sodium soy sauce, wasabi, and pickled ginger if desired.

title: Caprese Pasta Salad (General, Vegetarian, Quick)
description: A quick and refreshing pasta salad with the simple flavors of tomatoes, mozzarella, and basil.
ingredients: Fresh basil leaves (1/4 cup, roughly chopped)
instructions: In a large bowl, combine the cooled pasta, halved cherry tomatoes, and mozzarella balls.
Add the chopped fresh basil.
Drizzle with olive oil and balsamic glaze.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Toss gently to combine.
Serve immediately or chilled.

title: Sheet Pan Sausage and Peppers (General, Quick)
description: A quick and easy one-pan meal with flavorful sausage and colorful bell peppers and onions.
instructions: Preheat oven to 200Â°C (400Â°F).
Toss sausage slices, bell peppers, and onion with olive oil, oregano, garlic powder, salt, and pepper on a large baking sheet.
Spread in a single layer.
Roast for 20-25 minutes, or until sausage is cooked through and vegetables are tender and slightly browned.
Serve hot, optionally with a side of whole wheat bread.

title: Greek Chickpea Salad (Diabetes-Friendly, Vegetarian, Quick)
description: A refreshing and protein-packed salad with chickpeas, Mediterranean vegetables, and a tangy dressing.
instructions: In a bowl, combine chickpeas, cucumber, tomato, red onion, and olives.
In a small bowl, whisk together olive oil, red wine vinegar, oregano, dill, salt, and pepper.
Pour dressing over the chickpea and vegetable mixture and toss gently.
Stir in crumbled feta cheese.
Serve chilled or at room temperature.

title: Baked Lemon Herb White Fish (Low-Sodium, Quick)
description: A simple and healthy baked white fish seasoned with bright lemon and fresh herbs.
ingredients: White fish fillets (e.g., tilapia, cod - 2 x 150g)
instructions: Preheat oven to 200Â°C (400Â°F).
Place white fish fillets on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
Drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle with fresh parsley and pepper.
Arrange lemon slices on top of the fish.
Bake for 10-12 minutes, or until fish is cooked through and flakes easily.
Serve immediately.

title: Vegetable Curry with Coconut Milk (Kidney-Friendly, Vegetarian)
description: A flavorful and aromatic vegetable curry made with coconut milk and kidney-friendly vegetables.
instructions: Heat coconut oil in a pot over medium heat.
SautÃ© onion until softened, then add garlic and ginger and cook for 1 minute.
Stir in bell peppers and cauliflower and cook for 5 minutes.
Add green beans, coconut milk, and curry powder. Bring to a simmer and cook for 15-20 minutes until vegetables are tender.
Garnish with fresh cilantro before serving, optionally with a small portion of whole wheat pasta.

title: Smoked Salmon and Avocado Sushi Rolls (General, Sushi)
description: Delicious sushi rolls filled with rich smoked salmon and creamy avocado.
instructions: Lay a nori sheet on a bamboo rolling mat.
Spread a thin layer of sushi rice evenly over the nori, leaving a small border at the far edge.
Arrange slices of smoked salmon, avocado, and optional cream cheese across the rice.
Using the mat, roll the nori tightly.
Moisten the far edge of the nori with water to seal the roll.
Slice the roll into 6-8 pieces.
Serve with low-sodium soy sauce, wasabi, and pickled ginger if desired.

title: Pasta with Roasted Vegetables and Pesto (General, Vegetarian)
description: A flavorful pasta dish featuring roasted seasonal vegetables tossed with vibrant pesto.
ingredients: Assorted vegetables (e.g., zucchini, bell peppers, eggplant, cherry tomatoes - 2 cups, chopped)
instructions: Preheat oven to 200Â°C (400Â°F).
Toss chopped vegetables with olive oil, minced garlic, salt, and pepper on a baking sheet.
Roast for 20-25 minutes, or until vegetables are tender and slightly browned.
Cook pasta according to package directions.
Drain pasta and add it to a large bowl.
Toss with roasted vegetables and pesto. Sprinkle with optional parmesan cheese.
Serve warm.

title: Baked Chicken Breast with Roasted Root Vegetables (Heart Failure Friendly)
description: A simple and healthy meal featuring lean chicken and naturally flavorful roasted root vegetables.
instructions: Preheat oven to 200Â°C (400Â°F).
Toss carrots, sweet potato, and parsnips with olive oil, thyme, rosemary, and pepper on a baking sheet.
Arrange chicken breast among the vegetables.
Bake for 25-30 minutes, or until chicken is cooked through and vegetables are tender.
Garnish with fresh parsley before serving.

title: Lentil and Vegetable Stew (Heart Failure Friendly, Vegetarian)
description: A hearty and nutritious stew packed with vegetables and plant-based protein from lentils, seasoned with mild herbs.
ingredients: Fresh spinach (1 cup, wilted in at the end)
instructions: Heat olive oil in a pot over medium heat.
SautÃ© onion, celery, and carrots until softened.
Stir in lentils, diced tomatoes, vegetable broth, bay leaf, and marjoram.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 25-30 minutes, or until lentils are tender.
Remove bay leaf. Stir in spinach until wilted. Serve warm.

title: Baked White Fish with Dill and Lemon (Heart Failure Friendly, Quick)
description: A quick and light baked white fish seasoned with fresh dill and a touch of lemon.
ingredients: White fish fillets (e.g., cod, tilapia - 2 x 150g)
instructions: Preheat oven to 200Â°C (400Â°F).
Place white fish fillets on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
Drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle with fresh dill and pepper.
Place lemon slices on top of the fish.
Bake for 10-12 minutes, or until fish is cooked through and flakes easily.
Serve immediately.

title: Turkey and Vegetable Meatloaf (Heart Failure Friendly)
description: A leaner take on traditional meatloaf using ground turkey and incorporating finely chopped vegetables.
ingredients: Whole wheat breadcrumbs (1/2 cup, low sodium)
instructions: Preheat oven to 180Â°C (350Â°F).
In a large bowl, combine ground turkey, onion, carrot, celery, breadcrumbs, egg, parsley, and pepper.
Gently mix until just combined (avoid overmixing).
Shape the mixture into a small loaf and place it in a baking dish.
Spread low-sodium tomato paste over the top.
Bake for 45-50 minutes, or until cooked through.
Let it rest for a few minutes before slicing and serving.

title: Berry Smoothie (Heart Failure Friendly, Quick)
description: A refreshing and antioxidant-rich smoothie made with low-sodium ingredients and limited added sugar.
ingredients: Mixed berries (1 cup, fresh or frozen)
Plain Greek yogurt (1/2 cup, low fat)
instructions: Combine all ingredients in a blender.
Blend until smooth and creamy.
Add a little more almond milk if needed to reach desired consistency.
Serve immediately.

title: Tofu and Vegetable Skewers (Heart Failure Friendly, Vegetarian)
description: Grilled or baked tofu and colorful vegetables marinated in low-sodium seasonings.
instructions: Preheat grill or oven to 180Â°C (350Â°F).
In a bowl, gently toss tofu and vegetables with olive oil, lemon juice, oregano, garlic powder, and pepper.
Thread tofu and vegetables onto skewers.
Grill or bake for 15-20 minutes, turning occasionally, until vegetables are tender and tofu is lightly browned.
Serve hot.
